item.title: Sensex Edges Higher Amid Mixed Sectoral Trends; Metals Lead Gains
item.description: The Indian equity market closed marginally higher on 23 Jan 2026, with the Sensex gaining 67.42 points or 0.08% to settle at 82,374.79. Despite a cautious start and mixed sectoral performance, metals emerged as the top-performing sector, while realty lagged. Market breadth remained weak, reflecting investor caution amid global uncertainties and upcoming corporate earnings. Time: 7 minutes ago

item.title: Jio Financial Services Ltd Faces Challenges Amid Nifty 50 Membership and Sector Headwinds
item.description: Jio Financial Services Ltd, a recent entrant to the prestigious Nifty 50 index, is navigating a complex market environment marked by subdued price performance, a downgrade in its mojo rating, and shifting institutional holdings. Despite its large-cap status and sector prominence within the Non Banking Financial Company (NBFC) space, the stock has struggled to keep pace with benchmark indices, raising questions about its near-term outlook and strategic positioning. Time: 11 minutes ago

item.title: Eternal Ltd’s Nifty 50 Membership Highlights Institutional Shifts and Market Challenges
item.description: Eternal Ltd, a prominent player in the E-Retail and E-Commerce sector, has recently undergone a downgrade from Hold to Sell by MarketsMOJO, reflecting growing concerns over its valuation and near-term performance. Despite its significant presence as a Nifty 50 constituent, the stock has struggled to maintain momentum amid broader market volatility and sector-specific challenges. Time: 11 minutes ago

item.title: Max Healthcare Institute Ltd: Navigating Challenges Amidst Nifty 50 Membership
item.description: Max Healthcare Institute Ltd, a prominent constituent of the Nifty 50 index, has recently undergone a notable downgrade in its mojo grade from Hold to Sell, reflecting growing concerns over its market performance and valuation metrics. Despite its large-cap status and significant market capitalisation, the hospital sector heavyweight has struggled to keep pace with benchmark indices, prompting investors and analysts to reassess its outlook. Time: 11 minutes ago

item.title: Larsen & Toubro Ltd: Navigating Nifty 50 Membership Amid Mixed Market Performance
item.description: Larsen & Toubro Ltd. (L&T), a stalwart in the Indian construction sector and a prominent Nifty 50 constituent, has recently experienced a recalibration in its market standing. Despite its large-cap status and historical outperformance relative to the Sensex, the company’s latest Mojo Grade downgrade from Buy to Hold signals a cautious outlook amid evolving institutional holdings and sectoral pressures. This article analyses L&T’s current market position, the significance of its benchmark membership, and the implications for investors navigating the capital goods space. Time: 11 minutes ago
